A2 a long, flat board fixed horizontally, usually against a wall or inside a cupboard so that objects can be stored on it: a glass shelfon a/the shelf Store the remaining mixture on the top/bottom shelf of the refrigerator. One wall had shelves from floor to ceiling, crammed with books. See also

  specialized a flat area of rock underwater or on a cliff off the shelf
If a product can be bought off the shelf, it does not need to be specially made or asked for: buy something off the shelf It's often cheaper if you buy wallpaper off the shelf, rather than having to order it.
See more remove something from your shelves
When a shop removes something from its shelves, that product stops being available for sale there: They considered removing tobacco from their shelves to combat high smoking rates among teens.
